http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The shape of the stimulus
The patched cell used

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Stimulus experiment shape definition
Stimulus shape definition
Experimental activity description.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Activity shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent or entity for an activity, indicating that the agent or entity had a role in the activity. The associated agent or entity should be identified by an IRI.
An entity identified by an IRI and that was generated by the current activity.
An entity identified by an IRI and that was used in the current activity.

Start is when an activity is deemed to have been started by an entity, known as trigger. The activity did not exist before it starts. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity follows the activity's start. A start may refer to a trigger entity that set off the activity, or to an activity, known as starter, that generated the trigger.
The activity start time. It should precede the value of prov:endedAtTime.
The activity end time.
An activity qualified association allows to further specify the role and plan that an agent had.
An activity qualified usage allows to further specify the context of an entity usage: it's role, the time at which the usage started, why the entity is used,...

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Usage is the beginning of utilizing an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Usage shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The time at which the entity was used.
A role is the function of an entity or agent with respect to an activity, in the context of a usage, generation, invalidation, association, start, and end.
The used entity.
Materials used in protocol
Name of vendor of protocol
Steps of protocol
Warning for protocol
Usable in activity

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Protocol shape definition based on protocols.io json schema. The identifier of a protocol should be a valid IRI.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: Name of reagent/material used
Molar weight of reagent
Linear formula of reagent
Stock keeping unit of reagent/material
URL of reagent/material
Name of vendor of reagent
The value of nsg:hadProtocol should be of type nsg:ExperimentalProtocol.
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.
Number of repetitions of an activity (a measurement for example).
The minimum value of the quantitative value.
The maximum value of the quantitative value.
Human readable label.
The identifier of protocol such as a DOI, ISBN,...
Publishing date of protocol.
Author of the protocol
Sub-protocols of the protocol.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Protocol shape definition.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The value of nsg:hadProtocol should be of type nsg:Protocol.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Entity shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The entity name.
The entity description
URI of an entity sharing the same identity.
The dataset language.
Identifier
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
A Link towards the dataset license.
Date at which this entity was created.
The entity for which this entity is a revision of. An entity revision is a specific type of derivation.
The entity from which this entity was derived from.
A landing page describing the entity.
The date of the last update of this entity.
Keywords describing the entity.
The agent to which this entity was attributed to.
A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.
Information about the contribution of an agent during the generation of this dataset.
Generation.
Invalidation.
A reference to an entity representing an image that can be used as preview.
A dataset in downloadable form. The downloadable form has a specific format and is located at a specific location.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A shape to represent natural languages.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The Language name (e.g English).
An alias for the language name (e.g English => en).

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Entity derivation shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: An entity from which the current one derived from.
The optional activity that used the entity from which the current one derived from.
Usage is the beginning of utilizing an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity..
The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Key value type of identifier.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The property name.
The property name.
The orcid identifier

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: A shape for an ORCID based researcher identifier.
A shape for GRID (https://www.grid.ac) based organization identifier.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The property name.
The property value.
When followed this link leads to the actual data.
When followed this link leads to a resource providing further description on how to download the attached data.
A Link towards the distribution license.
The distribution name.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The pattern used here is temporary and not complete. The media type values need to be taken from a controlled vocabulary: to be handled in a next iteration.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The media value should start with one of the following application|audio|font|image|message|model|multipart|text|video followed by / and then any Alphanumeric characters.
The digest value.
The digest algorithm.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An instance of prov:Generation provides additional descriptions about the binary prov:wasGeneratedBy relation from a generated prov:Entity to the prov:Activity that generated it. For example, :cake prov:wasGeneratedBy :baking; prov:qualifiedGeneration [ a prov:Generation; prov:activity :baking; :foo :bar ]. Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Entity generation shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The time at which the entity was generated.
The activity that generates the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Invalidation is the start of the destruction, cessation, or expiry of an existing entity by an activity. The entity is no longer available for use (or further invalidation) after invalidation. Any generation or usage of an entity precedes its invalidation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Entity Invalidation shape

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: The time at which the entity was invalidated.
The activity that invalidates the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A schema:Organization can have a GRID identifier.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: A shape for describing an organization based on http://schema.org/Organization.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: Physical address of the organization.
Name of the organization

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Schema.org person specification is used as a vocabulary to describe a person.

http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#description.@value: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.
Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.
An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.
Person identifiers (e.g orcid)

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: The shape of an ontology term representing a species
NCBI species taxonomy ontology
The shape of an ontology term representing an animal strain
Animal strain
The shape of an ontology term representing a model simulation status
The shape of an ontology term representing brain parcellation layers
The shape of an ontology term representing a sex
Biological Sex
The shape of an ontology term representing a cell type
Cell Type Ontology.
The shape of an ontology term representing a microscope objective type
The shape of an ontology term representing a brain region
Brain Region ontology
The shape of an ontology term representing an activity type
Activity type ontology
The shape of an ontology term representing a stimulus type
The shape of an ontology term representing an eCode
The shape of an ontology term representing a role
The shape of an ontology term representing a license
The shape of an ontology term representing the types of somas of the reconstructed cell
The shape of an ontology term representing a unit code
The shape of an ontology term representing a labeling compound
The shape of an ontology term representing a morphological cell type
The shape of an ontology term representing an electrical cell type
The shape of an ontology term representing a cell line
The shape of an ontology term representing a gene
